DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: E. Aldo Arroyo;Arroyo, E. Aldo;Arroyo, E Aldo;Aldo Arroyo, E.;ARROYO, E. A.;ALDO ARROYO, E

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Ciencias Física - Universidad Nacional de Ingenieria (UNI)-Lima, Perú (2002). Especialização em Diploma Course in High Energy Physics - The Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics ICTP-Trieste, Italy (2004). Doutorado em Física - Instituto de Física Teórica (IFT), UNESP-São Paulo, Brasil (2008). Tem experiência na área de Física, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: conformal field models in string theory, BRST symmetry, superstrings and heterotic strings, topological strings and string field theory.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Ciencias Fisica from Universidad Nacional de Ingenieria (2002) and master's at Diploma Course in High Energy Physics from The Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics (2004). Has experience in Physic, focusing on Physic, acting on the following subjects: conformal field models in string theory, brst symmetry, superstrings and heterotic strings and topological strings.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Conformal Field Models in String Theory

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We explicitly compute up to the fifth mass-level the partition function of ten-dimensional pure spinor worldsheet variables including the spin dependence. After adding the contribution from the (xμ, θα, pα) matter variables, we reproduce the massive superstring spectrum. Even though pure spinor variables are bosonic, the pure spinor partition function contains fermionic states which first appear at the second mass-level. These fermionic states come from functions which are not globally defined in pure spinor space, and are related to the b ghost in the pure spinor formalism. This result clarifies the proper definition of the Hilbert space for pure spinor variables.
